    • Method Detail

      • isSuccess

        public boolean isSuccess()
        Description copied from interface: IAuthTokenModel
        Indicates whether fetching OAuth access token was successful.

        In case false is returned, no other check is performed and the synchronization process stops right at the start with an exception. Synchronizing with Smint.io requires a valid access token!
        This function will help to increase performance as no token action is performed in case the token has not been retrieved successfully before hand.

        No check is performed, whether the IAuthTokenModel.getAccessToken() is still valid. The server will tell anyway and a refresh is tried with IAuthTokenModel.getRefreshToken(). If that fails, too, an exception will abort the synchronization process.

        Specified by:
        isSuccess in interface IAuthTokenModel
        Returns:
        true for valid access tokens, of false in case acquiring an access token via OAuth has not been finished successfully (eg: aborted, failed).

      • setIsSuccess

        public AuthTokenImpl setIsSuccess(boolean isSuccess)
        Set a new value for isSuccess() and provide Fluent Interface.
        Parameters:
        isSuccess - set indicating value, whether retrieving the authentication token via OAuth procedure was successful.
        Returns:
        this for Fluent Interface

      • getAccessToken

        public String getAccessToken()
        Description copied from interface: IAuthTokenModel
        Returns the access token as returned by Smint.io OAuth authorization token server.

        After authorization with the Smint.io OAuth server, an access token is issued and returned with the server response. This token is the main indicator for authorization - it is like a combination of user name and password. All the authorization is based on this token. Hence it must be provided here.

        In case the access token has expired, a refresh is tried utilizing the #getRefreshToken(). If that is successful, then the new token is being stored for next use.

        Specified by:
        getAccessToken in interface IAuthTokenModel
        Returns:
        the identity token id_token that is part of the OpenID specification as sent by the Smint.io server. This token may be sent by the the Smint.io token server but not necessarily. If omitted by the server this function returns just null.

      • setAccessToken

        public AuthTokenImpl setAccessToken(String newAccessToken)
        Set a new value for getAccessToken() and provide Fluent Interface.
        Parameters:
        newAccessToken - the new OAuth access token to store as it was retrieved with OAuth authentication procedure.
        Returns:
        this for Fluent Interface

      • getRefreshToken

        public String getRefreshToken()
        Description copied from interface: IAuthTokenModel
        Returns the refresh token as (optionally) returned by Smint.io OAuth authorization server.

        The Smint.io OAuth server supports OpenID as well. The token ID is part of this specification. At the moment it is not required to authorize but in case the Smint.io server returns such a value, it is required to provide it here.

        Specified by:
        getRefreshToken in interface IAuthTokenModel
        Returns:
        the identity token id_token that is part of the OpenID specification as sent by the Smint.io server. This token may be sent by the the Smint.io token server but not necessarily. If omitted by the server this function returns just null.

      • setRefreshToken

        public AuthTokenImpl setRefreshToken(String newRefreshToken)
        Set a new value for getRefreshToken() and provide Fluent Interface.
        Parameters:
        newRefreshToken - the new OAuth refresh token to store as it was retrieved with OAuth authentication procedure.
        Returns:
        this for Fluent Interface

      • getIdentityToken

        public String getIdentityToken()
        Description copied from interface: IAuthTokenModel
        returns the identity token as (optionally) returned by Smint.io OAuth authorization server.

        The Smint.io OAuth server supports OpenID as well. The token ID is part of this specification. At the moment it is not required to authorize but in case the Smint.io server returns such a value, it is required to provide it here.

        Specified by:
        getIdentityToken in interface IAuthTokenModel
        Returns:
        the identity token id_token that is part of the OpenID specification as sent by the Smint.io server. This token may be sent by the the Smint.io token server but not necessarily. If omitted by the server this function returns just null.

      • getExpiration

        public OffsetDateTime getExpiration()
        Description copied from interface: IAuthTokenModel
        The expiration time of the access token.

        Every access token has an expiration time. Usually it is just a couple of hours or days. After the expiration time the token must be refreshed. The expiration time is transmitted along the access token with the token-server answer.

        The expiration time is used to avoid initial access with an expired token as it would definitely result in an authorization error. However, even if the access token has not yet expired, the server still may regard the token as invalid and may require a refresh of the token.

        Specified by:
        getExpiration in interface IAuthTokenModel
        Returns:
        the expiration time of the access token. If null then the access token does not expire.

      • setExpiration

        public AuthTokenImpl setExpiration(OffsetDateTime newExpireDate)
        Set a new value for getExpiration() and provide Fluent Interface.
        Parameters:
        newExpireDate - the new expire date for the access token.
        Returns:
        this for Fluent Interface
